meta.name: STEPS FETP India cost configuration
meta.description: Cost templates for FETP India Frontline, Intermediate and Advanced tiers, structured by component and compatible with the STEPS decision aid.
meta.author: Mesfin Genie and collaborators
meta.notes: Version 1.2 adds enriched meta, UI, ranges, mappings and layout fields while preserving the original tier/template structure and component amounts from earlier versions.
meta.intendedUse: To provide structured, editable programme cost templates for use in the STEPS decision-support tool, including per-cohort and per-trainee-per-month cost calculations.

metadata.description: Cost templates for STEPS FETP India decision aid. Values are aligned with official WHO, NIE and NCDC submissions and are intended for use in economic evaluation and decision-support tools.
metadata.notes: This configuration is designed to be editable by technical users (e.g. WHO, World Bank, MoH teams) without modifying the core JavaScript code.

currency.name: Indian Rupee
currency.notes: All monetary values in this configuration are expressed in Indian Rupees (INR). Programme templates are provided as total INR per cohort or per set of cohorts. The tool converts these to per-cohort and per-trainee-per-month values based on user inputs.

list.label: Salary and benefits
list.description: Salaries, wages and employment-related benefits for programme staff, faculty, mentors and administrators.

list.label: Equipment and supplies
list.description: Office equipment, IT hardware, software licences and other supplies required to run the programme.

list.label: Facilities
list.description: Rent, utilities and other facility-related costs for staff and programme offices.

list.label: Trainee support
list.description: Allowances, stipends, trainee equipment and software provided directly to trainees.

list.label: Training
list.description: Training materials, workshops, seminars and related delivery costs.

list.label: Travel expenses
list.description: In-country and international travel costs for trainees, mentors and faculty, including per diem and accommodation.

list.label: Other expenses
list.description: Other direct programme expenses not captured under specific categories.

list.label: Administrative support
list.description: Management, oversight and office maintenance requirements that support programme delivery.

list.label: In-kind contributions
list.description: In-kind salary and other contributions that are not directly billed to the programme budget.

list.label: Infrastructure costs
list.description: Facility upgrades, capital investments and equipment depreciation.

list.label: Utilities
list.description: Shared utilities such as electricity, water, cleaning and internet services.

list.label: Professional services
list.description: Legal, financial, auditing and other professional consulting services.

list.label: Training and capacity building
list.description: Training and development for staff who support the programme but are not trainees.

list.label: Opportunity cost
list.description: Economic value of trainee time and other resources that could have been used elsewhere (e.g. trainee salary while in training).

list.label: Other indirect costs
list.description: Other indirect costs related to the programme which are not captured under specific headings.

financialCost.label: Financial cost only
financialCost.description: Excludes opportunity cost components when summarising costs.

economicCost.label: Economic cost (including opportunity cost)
economicCost.description: Includes all components marked as opportunity cost in addition to financial costs.

economicHighOpportunityCost.label: Economic cost – high opportunity cost
economicHighOpportunityCost.description: Applies a 25% uplift to components tagged as opportunity cost, while including all financial costs.

defaults.notes: Legacy keys such as general.defaultTemplates are preserved for backwards compatibility. New default_*_template keys point to IDs defined under templates.{tier}.{id}.

who_frontline_6_cohorts.label: Frontline – WHO template (6 cohorts)
who_frontline_6_cohorts.description: WHO cost template for Frontline FETP covering six cohorts. Component totals are for six cohorts and are converted to per-cohort costs in the tool.
who_frontline_6_cohorts.notes: Category shares and opportunity cost share are computed dynamically from the component list under frontline.WHO.

who_intermediate_1_cohort.label: Intermediate – WHO template (1 cohort)
who_intermediate_1_cohort.description: WHO cost template for Intermediate FETP for one cohort. Component totals are used directly to compute cost shares.
who_intermediate_1_cohort.notes: Category shares and opportunity cost share are computed dynamically from the component list under intermediate.WHO.

nie_intermediate_1_cohort.label: Intermediate – NIE template (1 cohort)
nie_intermediate_1_cohort.description: NIE cost template for Intermediate FETP for one cohort. Totals are used to derive component shares.
nie_intermediate_1_cohort.notes: Opportunity cost is currently reported as zero but the structure is present to allow users to adjust it in the tool.

ncdc_intermediate_1_cohort.label: Intermediate – NCDC template (1 cohort)
ncdc_intermediate_1_cohort.description: NCDC cost template for Intermediate FETP for one cohort. Totals are used to derive cost shares.
ncdc_intermediate_1_cohort.notes: Opportunity cost is currently reported as zero but can be updated in-country using the same structure.

overall_intermediate_1_cohort.label: Intermediate – combined Overall template (WHO + NIE + NCDC)
overall_intermediate_1_cohort.description: Combined template for Intermediate FETP using Overall column (WHO + NIE + NCDC). Values approximate one intermediate cohort and are used for Overall intermediate cost shares.
overall_intermediate_1_cohort.notes: Category and opportunity-cost shares are derived from the components list under intermediate.Overall.

nie_advanced_1_cohort.label: Advanced – NIE template (1 cohort)
nie_advanced_1_cohort.description: NIE cost template for Advanced FETP for one cohort.
nie_advanced_1_cohort.notes: Opportunity cost is structurally present but currently set to zero; users can adjust this if estimates are available.

ncdc_advanced_1_cohort.label: Advanced – NCDC template (1 cohort)
ncdc_advanced_1_cohort.description: NCDC cost template for Advanced FETP for one cohort.
ncdc_advanced_1_cohort.notes: Opportunity cost is structurally present but currently set to zero.

overall_advanced_1_cohort.label: Advanced – combined Overall template (NIE + NCDC)
overall_advanced_1_cohort.description: Combined template for Advanced FETP created by summing NIE and NCDC entries for one advanced cohort.
overall_advanced_1_cohort.notes: Category shares are derived from the components list under advanced.Overall. Opportunity cost is currently zero but can be set in-country.

WHO.label: Frontline – WHO template (6 cohorts)
WHO.notes: WHO cost template for Frontline FETP covering six cohorts. Amounts are totals across six cohorts and are used to derive percentage shares by cost component. The STEPS tool converts these totals into per-cohort costs by dividing by six before applying user-selected cohort sizes and monthly cost assumptions.

components.description: Salaries and benefits for local staff (faculty and secretariat) dedicated to the frontline programme, including trainers, convenors, mentors and administrators.
Salary and benefits for consultants, advisors and other external experts, including costs borne by external funders.
Purchase costs for desktop computers, laptops, projectors, printers and similar items for frontline staff and faculty.
Software for data analysis, training delivery or general office use for frontline staff and faculty.
Lease of office space and utilities such as electricity, water and internet used by frontline FETP staff and faculty.
Trainee stipends, scholarships or other allowances for frontline trainees (not reported in this template).
Laptops, internet access and similar equipment provided to frontline trainees (not reported in this template).
Software licences provided directly to frontline trainees (not reported in this template).
Printing of training materials, manuals and other educational resources for frontline cohorts.
Organising training sessions for frontline cohorts, including venue hire, catering and other training event costs.
Travel for faculty, mentors and trainees within the country for training, outbreaks, meetings or conferences, including per diem, lodging and transport.
International travel for faculty, mentors and trainees for conferences, outbreaks and meetings (not reported for frontline in this template).
Any other direct cost associated with the frontline FETP (not specified in the WHO template).
Salaries for upper management who oversee frontline programme operations but are not involved in day-to-day delivery.
General office maintenance that is not directly attributable to the frontline programme but is necessary for operations.
In-kind salary costs for trainers, mentors and other support staff not directly charged to the frontline programme.
Upgrading or maintaining facilities used by the frontline programme.
Depreciation of high-value items such as computers and office furniture used in frontline delivery.
Shared utilities such as security, cleaning and shared internet access that benefit the wider organisation and the frontline programme.
Legal and financial services, such as auditing, compliance checks and contract negotiations (not separately reported for frontline).
Training and development of staff members who are not direct trainees but support the frontline programme.

components.subCategory: Trainee salary payments had they been employed
components.description: Estimated value of trainee salary time while in training rather than in normal duties. Treated as economic (opportunity) cost when the opportunity cost toggle is activated.
Any other indirect cost associated with the frontline FETP (none reported in the WHO template).

sections.label: Programme structure and scale
sections.description: Cohorts, trainee numbers and duration used to convert template totals to per-trainee-per-month costs.

sections.label: Economic assumptions
sections.description: Parameters used for discounting and endorsement-weighted costs.

templateId.description: Identifier of the selected cost template for the chosen tier.

cohortCount.description: Number of cohorts of the selected tier in the planning horizon.

monthsPerCohort.description: Duration in months used for per-trainee-per-month calculations when relevant.

endorsementRate.description: Proportion of decision-makers endorsing the programme configuration (used for endorsement-weighted cost metrics).

discountRate.description: Annual discount rate applied to future costs, where relevant.

includeOpportunityCost.description: Whether to include components tagged as opportunity cost in the cost totals.

scenarioKey.description: Pre-defined cost scenario determining whether opportunity cost is included and how it is weighted.
